author: evan ratliff
text: having grown up with real dogs and cats, i was puzzled by the trauma of children whose virtual pets died of neglect. so i got nintendo's newest digital pal, pokémon pikachu, and immediately set about trying to kill the pager-sized companion. i wanted to see if i too would tear up. my first strategy was to test pikachu's affinity for exercise. walking or running with the device activates an internal pedometer and generates life-sustaining "watts" that nourish the animal. so exercise i did - walking, jogging, and playing ultimate frisbee with the plastic pest dutifully clipped to me, hoping a virtual binge would do it in. no luck. then i tried being a deadbeat dad, gambling away watts using the pikachu minigame - a tiny slot machine. pikachu looked mad, and a day later it was gone.then, in a fit of sentimentality, i grabbed the device, hit the reset button to resurrect my fair-weather friend, and clipped it to my belt. i guess there's something to be said for a pet that gives you a second chance.pokémon pikachu: $19.95. nintendo: street credbrother's keepercryptic adventureshave it your wayshout it outkiller opbatman's second lifereality checkrobo scopemusicjust outta betareadmepersonalized checkingdeep knowledge'phone of silencewatts for dinnerthe public face of linuxcontributors
